intro: Cieca decaloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved cieca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several narrow, lance-shaped segments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
